medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient first noted no bowel movements (BMs) over the past couple of days, which did not particularly alarm her. She then developed intermittent sharp periumbilical abdominal pain yesterday, which became more severe overnight. She was able to tolerate a light dinner, but then had one episode of non-bilious non-bloody emesis at home and several more in the emergency department. Symptoms have been associated with chills at home, and an antispasmodic medication she tried was ineffective.
